main event: A bright object approximately 50 feet in diameter was spotted near Houston, Texas, hovering at 5,000 feet for over 30 minutes.
interesting points: The object had a light blue color with orange strobe-like flashes.
The elevation of the object from the horizon was approximately 40 degrees.
A pilot at Houston International Airport also spotted a similar object at the same time, and thought it was a meteor.
Additional checks with local Air Force and Air Guard squadrons, as well as NASA officials, did not reveal any known satellite passover or missile firing in conjunction with the sighting.
The witness, a civilian at Chennault AFB, described the object as a bright, falling metallic object that did not exhibit any decay in rate of speed or duration consistent with normal aircraft.
sighted object: a bright, cylindrical object approximately 50 feet long
witnesses: a civilian at Chennault AFB and a pilot at Houston International Airport
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
